module.title: toponyms
module.p: Toponyms are names identifying places and other geographical entities.
Like other kinds of name, toponyms can be classified into two distinct grammatical types –

ul.li: toponymic proper nouns eg. Barraigh Barra, Glaschu Glasgow, Alba Nuadh Nova Scotia
toponymic name-descriptions eg. Am Ploc Plockton, Dùthaich MhicAodh North Sutherland, Linne Foirthe The Firth of Forth

module.p: Toponyms can also be classified semantically according to the kind of geographical entity they refer to –

ul.li: islands and districts eg. Barraigh, Dùthaich MhicAodh
towns and settlements eg. Glaschu, Ceann Loch Chille Chiarain Campbeltown
countries and continents eg. Aimearaga a Tuath North America, A’ Ghreug Greece
mountains and uplands eg. Sùilebheinn Suilven, Beinn a’ Bhreacaidh Ben Vrackie, Am Monadh Ruadh The Cairngorms
rivers, lakes and seas eg. Linne Foirthe, Loch Obha Loch Awe, A’ Mhaoil The Minch
